meanings.definition: To become plumper or fuller in size or shape.
meanings.sent1: After eating lots of healthy food, the cat was plumpening nicely.
meanings.sent2: The pumpkin was slowly plumpening as it absorbed water from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The balloon was plumpening so much that it looked like it might burst!
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks plumpening with laughter, she looked more joyful than ever.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden were plumpening with the arrival of spring, blooming beautifully.

meanings.definition: The act of making something plumper or fuller.
meanings.sent1: The plumpening of the dough was essential for the perfect bread.
meanings.sent2: She used a special cream for the plumpening of her lips.
meanings.sent3: The plumpening of the pillow made it extra comfortable for sleeping.
meanings.sent4: The plumpening of the clouds signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The plumpening of the fruit made it irresistible to the hungry squirrel.
